commitMessage:
@@@
Sync folders for tests and test-libraries to separate "projects" in the open-source.


Revision created by MOE tool push_codebase.
MOE_MIGRATION=2563


git-svn-id: https://guava-libraries.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@528 8138a162-5c33-11de-8abc-d1c337b90d21

@@@Add lazyStackTrace.
-------------
Created by MOE: http://code.google.com/p/moe-java
MOE_MIGRATED_REVID=85099500

@@@Convert much of Guava to Truth by using Refaster.

The motivation was my wish for a better ThrowablesTest error message in https://github.com/google/guava/issues/2130 (though I'm pretty confident that the problem there is \n vs. \r\n).
I made a lot of changes.  but I left a lot undone. In particular.  I avoided most of the collection assertions.  since we often want to test specific collection methods. e.g..  we don't necessarily want get() to be rewritten to containsKey().
-------------
Created by MOE: http://code.google.com/p/moe-java
MOE_MIGRATED_REVID=101020845

@@@Make some of Throwables available under GWT.

Fixes #2457

Created by MOE: https://github.com/google/moe

@@@Apply `assertTrue(obj instanceof Class)` -> `assertThat(obj).isInstanceOf(Class.class)` refactorings to c.g.common.

@@@Replace usages of Truth's deprecated hasMessage() with hasMessageThat() in Guava tests.
